Scott_McQuaig:
{{short description|American country music singer-songwriter (born 1959)}} {{Distinguish|Scott McCuaig}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Scott McQuaig | image = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1959|01|27}} | origin = [[Meridian, Mississippi]] | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1981–present | label = [[Universal Records (1988 record label)|Universal]], [[Capitol Records|Capitol]], Scott McQuaig Records | associated_acts = Scott McQuaig and The Tomcats | website = www.scottmcquaigmusic.com }} '''Scott McQuaig''' (born January 27, 1959, in [[Meridian, Mississippi]]{{cite web |url=https://procountrymusic.com/2020/03/23/a-song-away-from-you-the-scott-mcquaig-story/ |title=A Song Away From You; The Scott McQuaig Story |website=ProCountryMusic.com |date=Mar 23, 2020 |access-date=May 7, 2024}}) is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter. In 1989, McQuaig charted two singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart.{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2005|publisher=Record Research, Inc|page=249|year=2005|isbn=0-89820-165-9}} A third single charted on the ''[[RPM (magazine)|RPM]]'' Country Tracks chart in Canada in 1990.{{cite web|url=http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/rpm/028020-119.01-e.php?brws_s=1&file_num=nlc008388.1274&type=1&interval=24&PHPSESSID=40kb0m3fdo6j26trfhabp6l4k2|title=RPM Country Tracks for July 21, 1990|work=[[RPM (magazine)|RPM]]|accessdate=December 17, 2010}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:10em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Scott McQuaig'' | * Release date: March 27, 1990 * Label: [[Capitol Records]] |- ! scope="row"| ''I'm Still Falling'' | * Release date: November 10, 2012 * Label: Scott McQuaig Music |- !''A Song Away from You'' ! * Release date: April 14, 2018 * Label: Scott McQuaig Music |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
positions ! rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Hot Country Songs|US Country]] ! width="45"| [[RPM (magazine)|CAN Country]] |- | rowspan="2"| 1989 ! scope="row"| "Honky Tonk Amnesia" | 56 | — | align="left" rowspan="3"| ''Scott McQuaig'' |- ! scope="row"| "Johnny and the Dreamers" | 54 | — |- | 1990 ! scope="row"| "Old Memory" | —A | 52 |- | colspan="5" style="font-size:8pt"| "—" denotes releases that did not chart |- |} '''Notes:''' *A "Old Memory" did not chart on Hot Country Songs, but peaked at No. 6 on Hot Country Radio Breakouts.{{cite magazine|url=http://americanradiohistory.com/Archive-Billboard/90s/1990/BB-1990-03-31.pdf|title=Hot Country Radio Breakouts|date=March 31, 1990|magazine=Billboard}} ==Music videos== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !
